com.tsgrp.migration.util

Class ExecutionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.util.ExecutionHelper

  • public class ExecutionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by: Marc Sernatinger Date: Jan 2, 2008 Time: 1:25:13 PM ExecutionHelper is a helper class to easily spawn an external process, feed it input, check for success/error, and package the output in a number of ways.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setRowDelimiter

        public void setRowDelimiter(java.lang.String s)
        A string (not regexp) which will be used to split the program's output into multiple Strings, line-by-line. Usually this is the OS's line.separator, which is the default.
        Parameters:
        s - The string along which to split the result's lines.

      • setColDelimiter

        public void setColDelimiter(java.lang.String s)
        Ignored if colDelimiter is set; a string (not regexp) which will be used to split the program's output lines into multiple columns. Usually this is a space, which is the default.
        Parameters:
        s - The string along which to split the result's lines.

      • setColumnFormat

        public void setColumnFormat(int[][] columnFormat)
        If left null, colDelimiter will be used to split result into columns; sets the number and start/end indexes of columns into which each row of output should be substring'd.
        Parameters:
        columnFormat - - An array of 2-element int arrays. The two ints in each array are the start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) index for the substring of the given column. Columns can overlap each other. If the second element is less than 0, the column continues to the end of the String.

      • setSuccessPattern

        public void setSuccessPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Creates a regular expression which must be found in the program's output in order for command's execution to be considered a success.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The regular expression to match for.

      • setFailurePattern

        public void setFailurePattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Creates a regular expression which if found in the program's output amounts to a failure of the program's execution.
        Parameters:
        pattern -

      • setIgnoreHeaderLines

        public void setIgnoreHeaderLines(int n)
        Sets the number of lines at the beginning of program output to ignore, default is 0.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of lines to ignore

      • setIgnoreFooterLines

        public void setIgnoreFooterLines(int n)
        Sets the number of lines at the end of program output to ignore; default is 0.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of lines to ignore.

      • getOutputAsStringBuffer

        public java.lang.StringBuffer getOutputAsStringBuffer()
        Must be called after executeCommand(java.lang.String); returns the output of the program minus however many leading and trailing lines are set to be ignored, in a StringBuffer
        Returns:
        The program output as a StringBuffer.

      • getOutputAsArrayOfStrings

        public java.lang.String[] getOutputAsArrayOfStrings()
        Must be called after executeCommand(java.lang.String); uses the set delimiter to break the program output into a String array.
        Returns:
        An array of strings comprising the program output, in order.

      • getOutputAsListOfStrings

        public java.util.List getOutputAsListOfStrings()
        Must be called after executeCommand(java.lang.String); uses the set delimiter to break the program output into a list of Strings
        Returns:
        A list of strings comprising the program output, in order.

      • getOutputAsListOfStringArrays

        public java.util.List getOutputAsListOfStringArrays()
        Must be called after executeCommand(java.lang.String); breaks down the output into lists of String arrays, breaking each row into Strings of pre-set length (if columns is set) or splitting by colDelimiter otherwise. Mostly useful for columnar output
        Returns:
        A list of String arrays

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(java.lang.String command)
                    throws ExecutionHelper.ExecutionHelperException
        Execute the single command with no arguments and no input.
        Parameters:
        command -
        Throws:

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(java.lang.String[] commandArray)
                    throws ExecutionHelper.ExecutionHelperException
        Execute the single command with arguments and no input.
        Parameters:
        commandArray -
        Throws:
        ExecutionHelper.ExecutionHelperException

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(java.lang.String[] commandArray,
                           java.io.File inputFile)
                    throws ExecutionHelper.ExecutionHelperException
        Executes the provided command, stores the output a StringBuffer minus any leading or trailing lines that have been set to be excluded. The success and failure patterns are then matched to determine if the program executed correctly. Gobble all streams associated with the child Process to try and prevent running out of file handles.
        Parameters:
        commandArray - The command to be run. String at index 0 is the command name, all others are arguments to the command.
        inputFile - A file that contains input to the command being run
        Throws:
        ExecutionHelper.ExecutionHelperException
